Package jetbrains.exodus.io

Class DataReaderWriterProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • jetbrains.exodus.io.DataReaderWriterProvider
  • public abstract class DataReaderWriterProvider
extends java.lang.Object
    Service provider interface for creation instances of DataReader and DataWriter. DataReader and DataWriter are used by Log implementation to perform basic operations with blocks (.xd files) and basic read/write/delete operations.

    Service provider interface is identified by a fully-qualified name of its implementation. When opening an Environment, DEFAULT_READER_WRITER_PROVIDER is used as default provide name. To use a custom I/O provider, specify its fully-qualified name as a parameter of EnvironmentConfig.setLogDataReaderWriterProvider(java.lang.String).

    On Environment creation new instance of DataReaderWriterProvider is created.

    Since:
    1.3.0
    See Also:
    Block, DataReader, DataWriter, EnvironmentConfig.getLogDataReaderWriterProvider(), EnvironmentConfig.setLogDataReaderWriterProvider(java.lang.String)

    • Method Detail

      • newReaderWriter

        public abstract jetbrains.exodus.core.dataStructures.Pair<DataReader,​DataWriter> newReaderWriter​(@NotNull
                                                                                                       @NotNull java.lang.String location)
        Creates pair of new instances of DataReader and DataWriter by specified location. What is location depends on the implementation of DataReaderWriterProvider, e.g. for FileDataReaderWriterProvider location is a full path on local file system where the database is located.
        Parameters:
        location - identifies the database in this DataReaderWriterProvider
        Returns:
        pair of new instances of DataReader and DataWriter

      • isInMemory

        public boolean isInMemory()
        Returns true if the DataReaderWriterProvider creates in-memory DataReader and DataWriter.
        Returns:
        true if the DataReaderWriterProvider creates in-memory DataReader and DataWriter

      • onEnvironmentCreated

        public void onEnvironmentCreated​(@NotNull
                                 @NotNull Environment environment)
        Callback method which is called when an environment is been opened/created. Can be used in implementation of the DataReaderWriterProvider to access directly an Environment instance, its config, etc. Creation of environment is not completed when the method is called.
        Parameters:
        environment - Environment instance which is been opened/created using this DataReaderWriterProvider

      • getProvider

        @Nullable
public static @Nullable DataReaderWriterProvider getProvider​(@NotNull
                                                             @NotNull java.lang.String providerName)
        Gets a DataReaderWriterProvider implementation by specified provider name.
        Parameters:
        providerName - fully-qualified name of DataReaderWriterProvider implementation
        Returns:
        DataReaderWriterProvider implementation or null if the service could not be loaded
